website_summaries.verdict: Elegant style, raw power, and sophisticated features make the HTC One M8 an excellent smartphone choice for anyone but the most exacting photographer.
pros: The HTC One M8's sumptuous aluminum body makes a beautiful background for this top-flight smartphone's brilliant 5-inch display
It runs on a powerful quad-core processor and Android KitKat, the stereo speakers deliver excellent sound, and the depth-sensing camera brings a ton of useful features
cons: The One M8’s battery is not user-removable, making it harder to replace once the battery inevitably wears out
The phone's sealed chassis is not water-resistant, and the One M8's photos look less sharp than competitors'

customer_reviews.title: Phone has a built-in modification. Can't install security updates outside of USA! very annoying
customer_reviews.text: Phone was not TOTALLY unlocked, as said.We bought it from Scharter Store on Amazon site, and only about a month after receiving it, when we tried to install some security updates on the phone, we got an error message saying we can't... We contacted the retailer, as apparently it's not totally unlocked and open for free use all around the world, as it has a built in modification, which enables these updates only while being (physically!) in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Phone signal fully lost after less than a month
customer_reviews.text: Phone signal fully lost after less than a month. Seller refunded once I sent back the phone.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing buy
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed! The phone is not able to update to the latest marshmallow Software for Android..it keeps giving a system variant error message...the double tap feature is not work either. I had phone tech look at the phone and he said it's refurbished...I will be returning the phone since since it didn't meet the expectations that was set.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy the phone from Vicutor!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the phone from Vicutor. What I got was a used phone which has been rooted prior to purchase. The front camera doesn't work, but I'm hoping the reason for that is the phone beeing rooted. I am currently contacting HTC Support to try and fix my problem. The phone seems to be really good, but my seller is the problem. As soon as you see the name Vicutor: run. RUN!!

customer_reviews.title: The device can not be updated since it says that ...
customer_reviews.text: The device can not be updated since it says that it has a modified version of the original software and it has been impossible to install the original version since the PC does not recognize the device, the device does not recognize any headphone either. It also says that it is an unlocked phone which is false since it was fabricated to work with Verizon and that is the reason why it has a modified version of the original softwatre. I have to recognize that the seller offered to exchange the product but right now I'm not in the US and it is a problem to send it back in order to get another one.

customer_reviews.title: Works well during 1 month...
customer_reviews.text: This phone was great the first months then all the problems started... Some times the keyboard doesn't pop up and you have to restart the phone to have it back. On top of that the GPS doesn't work at all, impossible to use this phone to run, drive... seems to be a hardware issue. And now it won't even turn on apart except when charging. I can't do anything as there is no warranty. Don't buy this phone, for this price you'd better get something you can exchange or return.

customer_reviews.title: I've had it less than three months and its already in poor condition. Great phone, poor health.
customer_reviews.text: I personally love this phone, immensely, but when I received it, the upper speaker was partially blown. It still plays music out loud, but if I turn it up too high, it rattles. The Boom Speakers are half the reason I chose this phone, so that's quite the bummer. Also, after having this phone for a couple months, the screen itself is starting to pull up with the glass screen protector. I can see INSIDE the phone. I'm not sure if that can be re-glued down but I guess I'll have to just figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Lizard

customer_reviews.title: I was sent a faulty phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone to start off with, but then after a few days of having it, the screen started to have a mind of its own and the phone keeps turning off randomly, even if it's at 90% battery. I hold the power button to turn it back on and it loads the white HTC screen, but then the screen goes black again and it's a vicious cycle. The only thing that recovers the phone is when I plug the charger in. However, when I pull the charger out the screen goes black. I'm annoyed and frustrated with this and haven't the time to be dealing with these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Pippin

Dual 4 Megapixel Camera (2688x 1520 pixels) w/ Autofocus, Dual-LED Flash + Font-Facing 5 Megapixel Camera + Video
Quad-core 2.3 GHz Krait 400 Processor, Chipset: Qualcomm MSM8974AB Snapdragon 801
Internal Memory: 32GB, 2GB RAM + microSD Slot Expandable up to 128GB
